errors.ImportWrongOrMissingId: ID is missing or not valid for at least on stop node.
errors.GeojsonIsInvalid: Stop node geojson data is invalid.

transitNode.ConfirmMultipleDelete: Do you confirm deletion of those stop nodes? Only the nodes through which no path passes will be deleted.
transitNode.ConfirmAllDelete: Do you confirm deletion of all unused stop nodes? Only the nodes through which no path passes will be deleted.

transitAgency.Name: Name

errors.AcronymMustBeUnique: Acronym must be unique (another agency has this acronym)

transitScenario.OnlyAgencies: Exclusively included agencies (all included if empty)
transitScenario.OnlyLines: Exclusively included lines (all included if empty)
transitScenario.OnlyNodes: Exclusively included nodes (all included if empty)
transitScenario.OnlyModes: Exclusively included modes (all included if empty)
transitScenario.Name: Name
transitScenario.ConfirmDelete: Do you confirm deletion of this scenario?

errors.ServicesAreRequired: At least one service must be selected

transitScenario.HelpText:
A Scenario is a network configuration that allows you to model different transit possibilities. It lets you:
- Include or exclude specific lines, agencies, or transit modes
- Create alternative network plans for comparison
- Test potential transit network changes

Example: "Summer Reduced Service" or "Proposed New Line Network"

transitService.Name: Name
transitService.ConfirmMerge: Do you confirm merging the selected services? Timetables associated with those services will now be part of the new service and merged services will be deleted.
transitService.CannotMerge: Failed to merge services for some lines. You'll have to edit them manually. Previous services will be kept:
transitService.ConfirmDelete: Do you confirm deletion of this service? There are no schedules currently associated with it.
transitService.ConfirmDeleteWithSchedule: Do you confirm deletion of this service? Schedules associated with this service will also be deleted. This operation cannot be undone.
transitService.ConfirmDeleteUnused: Do you confirm deletion of all unused services? The unused services are those with no schedules associated with it.

errors.NameAlreadyExists: A service with this name already exists
errors.StartDateIsRequired: Validity period start date is required.
errors.EndDateIsRequired: Validity period end date is required.

transitService.HelpText:
A Service defines when and how transit lines operate. It specifies:
- Operating days (weekdays, weekends)
- Active date range
- Specific schedule times

Example: "Weekday Metro Schedule - Running every 10 minutes from 6 AM to 10 PM"

transitSchedule.ConfirmDelete: Do you confirm deletion of this timetable?
transitSchedule.batchMinTwoPathWarning: Warning: only lines with at least two paths are displayed in the list. Batch timetable editing does not yet support single paths.

errors.ChooseIntervalOrNumberOfUnits: Specify the interval in minutes or the number of units but not both (incompatible)
errors.NoServiceInServiceCollection: You need to create at least one service to be able to generate timetables

transitSchedule.CustomEndAt: End of period (no departure from this time) (HH:MM)
transitSchedule.OverwriteScheduleWarningBatch: Warning: {{n}} line(s) already have a schedule for this service. The existing schedule will be overwritten.

transitUnit.ConfirmDelete: Do you confirm deletion of this unit?

transitGarage.Name: Name

transitLine.ConfirmDelete: Do you confirm deletion of this line? Line's paths and timetables will also be deleted.
transitLine.AllowSameLineTransfers: Allow transferring to the same line

errors.ShortnameOrLongnameIsRequired: Either line number or name must be specified, potentially both.

ROWcategoriesDescription.A: Fully controlled separated track/lanes used exclusively by transit vehicles, priority at all time
ROWcategoriesDescription.B: Separated track/lanes with physical barrier 100% of the distance (fence, wall, median or step), priority at every shared intersection
ROWcategoriesDescription.B-: Separated track/lanes with physical barrier at least 50% of the distance, no non-transit turning lanes in transit ROW, some priority at shared intersections
ROWcategoriesDescription.C+: On-street with mixed traffic, without physical barrier (or less than 50% of the distance), with reserved lanes and/or priority at intersections
ROWcategoriesDescription.C: On-street with mixed traffic, without physical barrier (or less than 50% of the distance), without reserved lanes and with limited or no priority at intersections

transitStation.Name: Name
transitStation.ConfirmDelete: Do you confirm deletion of this station?

transitPath.ConfirmDelete: Do you confirm deletion of this path? Path's timetables will be disabled.
transitPath.Name: Name
transitPath.MaxTemporalTortuosityInfo: Travel time with stops / travel time with fastest route between terminals
transitPath.TemporaryManualRouting: Temporary activate click on map mode
transitPath.MinMatchingTimestamp: Minimum map matching routing timestamp interval (in seconds), default to 500
transitPath.MinMatchingTimestampHelp: This is the timestamp interval to use between each waypoints while doing the map matching to route the path. Smaller values (less than 500) will reduce unexpected detours but may fail to route on long segments between stop nodes in the path (more waypoints would then be needed). Higher values (more than 500) will allow the map matching to successfully route more often, but it may also add unexpected detours.
transitPath.IncreaseRoutingRadiiToIncludeExistingPat: Adapt nodes radii to fit current shape
Increase path nodes routing radii if the path shape is too far from some nodes (max 200m). Nodes routing radii will be ignored.
transitPath.IncludingDwellTimesAndLayover: With dwell times and layover time
transitPath.PathChangeWillAffectSchedulesWhatDoYouWa: Changes to this path will affect associated timetables. What do you want to do?
transitPath.IgnorePathChangesOnSchedule: Save changes, but keep old timetables
transitPath.MinDwellTimeSecondsHelp: At each node associated with this path, the dwell time used is the greater value between the default dwell time at that node (which can be modified by selecting the node in the Nodes section) and the value specified here for the path. If the checkbox below is checked, the dwell times specified in the nodes associated with this path will be ignored and replaced with the default dwell time for this path.
transitPath.ClickOnTransitNodeToStart: Select a transit node to start the path
transitPath.HelpText:
Click on node: Add the node at the end of the path
Click on the map: Add a waypoint at the end
Shift-click on node: Add a node at the beginning of the path
Alt-click on node: Remove the node
m: Toggle manual mode for path calculation
Clic on the line + drag waypoint & drop on node: Add node in the middle of a path
transitPath.warningFromGtfs: Warning! This transit path was imported from a GTFS. Recomputing its path could change the geography and timings.

errors.NeedAtLeast2NodesOrStops: Please add at least two nodes or stops to the path.
errors.RoutingFailed: Could not calcualte routing. Please make sure the path nodes/stops are near routable roads/tracks and that waypoints are valid and in the right order and that the routing engine and mode are correctly set.
errors.MissingGeometry: Shape could not be generated (geometry is missing). Please verify waypoints and nodes/stops sequence.
errors.RoutingModeNotAvailableOnServer: This path was made with a routing mode that is unavailable on this server. Updating it may cause the geography to change. Consult your server administrator for more information.
errors.DefaultRunningSpeedIsRequiredForManualAn: Cruising speed is required for custom or manual routing.
errors.DefaultRunningSpeedIsTooHigh: Cruising speed is too high for this mode.
errors.DefaultRunningSpeedIsTooLow: Cruising speed is too low for this mode.
errors.MinDwellTimeIsInvalid: Minimum dwell time is invalid or too high (max 600 sec.)
errors.DefaultDwellTimeIsInvalid: Default dwell time is invalid or too high (max 600 sec.)

transitRouting.AccessibilityMapExampleDurationAndNumber: A total duration of 60 minutes with a number of polygons of 3 implies that we will obtain three polygons: accessibility at 20 minutes, 40 minutes and 60 minutes.
transitRouting.AccessibilityMapExampleDelta: A delta of 15 minutes with an interval of 5 minutes implies that the polygon area will be averaged over polygons obtained 15 minutes before, 10 minutes before, 5 minutes before, at specified time, 5 minutes after, 10 minutes after and 15 minutes after the specified departure or arrival time.
transitRouting.NumberOfAccessiblePOIs: Number of accessible Points of interest
transitRouting.NumberOfAccessiblePOIsByCategory: Number of accessible Points of interest by category
transitRouting.NumberOfAccessiblePOIsInNMinutesByCatego: Number of accessible Points of interest in {{n}} minutes by category
transitRouting.NumberOfAccessiblePOIsInNMinutesByDetail: Number of accessible Points of interest in {{n}} minutes by detailed category
transitRouting.NumberOfAccessiblePOIsByDetailedCategory: Number of accessible Points of interest by detailed category
transitRouting.AccessiblePOIsPopup: The data used to determine accessible Points of interest was downloaded from OpenStreetMap and imported into the database. The results may be inaccurate if the accessibility polygon is not contained entirely within the imported area.
transitRouting.MinimumWaitingTimeMinutesHelp: To account for timetable uncertainty, this value should be greater or equal to 1 minute. Suggested value: 3 minutes
transitRouting.MaximumAccessEgressTravelTimeMinutes: Maximum access and egress travel time (minutes)
transitRouting.MaximumAccessEgressTravelTimeMinutesHelp: To avoid long calculation time, a maximum value of 20 minutes is suggested.
transitRouting.MaximumTransferTravelTimeMinutes: Maximum access travel time when transferring (minutes)
transitRouting.MaximumTransferTravelTimeMinutesHelp: To avoid long calculation time, this value has a maximum of 20 minutes.
transitRouting.MaximumTotalTravelTimeMinutes: Maximum total travel time including access and egress (minutes)
transitRouting.MaximumFirstWaitingTimeMinutesHelp: If waiting time at first stop is greater than this value for a line, ignore the departure of this line at this stop
transitRouting.MinimumWaitingTimeSecondsMustBeAtLeast1M: Minimum waiting time must be at least 1 minute
transitRouting.SaveTripForBatch: Save this route for batch routing

errors.RoutingModesIsEmpty: Please select at least one routing mode.
errors.DepartureAndArrivalTimeAreBlank: Departure or arrival time is required.
errors.DepartureAndArrivalTimeAreBothNotBlank: Please provide departure time OR arrival time, but not both.
errors.AccessEgressTravelTimeSecondsNoNegative: The maximum access and egress travel time cannot be negative
errors.TransferTravelTimeSecondsTooLarge: The maximum access travel time when transferring is too high. Maximum: 20 minutes
errors.TransferTravelTimeSecondsNoNegative: The maximum access travel time when transferring cannot be negative
errors.NoResultFound: The transit routing has returned no result. Verify the values for access and waiting time. Also make sure the origin and destination locations are not too far from the transit network.
errors.TrRoutingServerNotRunning: The transit routing server is not running. Click on the transit server startup icon on the top right of the window to start it.
errors.TrRoutingServerError: The transit routing server returned an error: {{error}}.
errors.IdFieldIsMissing: The column for id is required.
errors.OriginIsMissingLon: The column for origin x (or longitude) is required.
errors.OriginIsMissingLat: The column for origin y (or latitude) is required.
errors.DestinationIsMissingLon: The column for destination x (or longitude) is required.
errors.DestinationIsMissingLat: The column for destination y (or latitude) is required.
errors.XAttributeIsMissing: The column for x (or longitude) is required.
errors.YAttributeIsMissing: The column for y (or longitude) is required.
errors.TimeFieldDepartureOrArrivalIsMissing: The column for departure or arrival time is required.
errors.TimeFieldDepartureOrArrivalIsMissingForm: The departure/arrival time format is required.
errors.DeltaIntervalIsTooLarge: Delta Interval is to high (maximum 30 minutes).
errors.DeltaIntervalMustBeAMultipleOfDelta: The delta interval must be a multiple of the delta.
errors.NumberOfPolygonsIsMissing: The number of polygons is missing.
errors.NumberOfPolygonsIsInvalid: The number of polygons is invalid.
errors.NumberOfPolygonsIsTooLarge: The number of polygons is too high (must be lower or equal to the total duration).
errors.MinWaitingTimeIsTooLarge: Minimum waiting time is too high (maximum 10 minutes).
errors.MaxAccessEgressTravelTimeSecondsIsMissin: The maximum access and egress travel time is missing.
errors.MaxAccessEgressTravelTimeSecondsIsInvali: The maximum access and egress travel time is invalid.
errors.MaxTransferTravelTimeSecondsIsMissing: The maximum access travel time when transferring is missing.
errors.MaxTransferTravelTimeSecondsIsInvalid: The maximum access travel time when transferring is invalid.
errors.WalkingSpeedMpsIsMissing: Walking speed is missing (default should be 5 km/h).
errors.WalkingSpeedMpsIsTooLarge: Walking speed is too high (maxmium 10 km/h).
errors.WalkingSpeedMpsIsTooLow: Walking speed is too low (minimum 2 km/h).
errors.NO_ROUTING_FOUND: The transit routing has returned no result. Verify the values for access and waiting time.
errors.NO_ACCESS_AT_ORIGIN: The transit routing has returned no result: The origin is too far from the transit network.
errors.NO_ACCESS_AT_DESTINATION: The transit routing has returned no result: The destination is too far from the transit network.
errors.NO_ACCESS_AT_ORIGIN_AND_DESTINATION: The transit routing has returned no result: The origin and destination are too far from the transit network.
errors.NO_SERVICE_FROM_ORIGIN: The transit routing has returned no result: There is no service from origin within the specified parameters.
errors.NO_SERVICE_TO_DESTINATION: The transit routing has returned no result: There is no service to destination within the specific parameters.
errors.MISSING_PARAM_SCENARIO: The scenario_id parameter has not been specified or the scenario does not exist on the server.
errors.MISSING_PARAM_TIME_OF_TRIP: The time of trip is missing.
errors.PARAM_ERROR_UNKNOWN: Unknown error in one of the query parameters.
errors.DataError: Invalid cache data for the routing engine. Try to save all data again. If the problem persists, contact the administrators.
errors.ErrorForMode: Routing calculation for mode '{{mode}}' has failed. No results were returned.
errors.TransitBatchRouteCannotBeCalculatedBecau: An error occurred during batch calculation. Please verify your input file and parameters and try again. If the problem persists, contact the administrators.
errors.InvalidDepartureOrArrivalTime: Departure or arrival time are invalid
errors.InvalidOriginDestinationCoordinates: Origin and destination coordinates are invalid
errors.BatchRouteMoreErrors: The file contains more errors, not detailed here
errors.ErrorSavingOdTripsToDb: Error saving od pairs to database. The data source was not saved.
errors.DataSourceDoesNotExists: The specified data source does not exists.
errors.DataSourceAlreadyExists: A data source with that name already exists for OD calculations.
errors.UserDiskQuotaReached: Maximum allowed disk space has been reached. Please delete old tasks to delete their files.
errors.RoutingParametersInvalidForBatch: Routing parameters are invalid. Make sure the scenario is set and times have a valid value.

results.LostTimeAtDepartureIfNonOptimised: Time lost if departure time not optimized
results.LostTimeAtArrivalIfNonOptimised: Time lost if arrival time not optimized
results.TotalTransferTravelTime: Total access travel time when transferring
results.TotalAccessTravelTime: Total access time (access, egress and access when transferring)
results.AlternativeWalkPath: There is an alternative walking only path

transitRouting.TotalNumberOfNoTransferTrips: Total number of no transfer trips (direct)
transitRouting.AverageNumberOfTransfers: Average number of transfers per trip
transitRouting.AverageAccessEgressTime: Average access/egress travel time per trip
transitRouting.AverageWaitingTime: Average waiting time per trip (departure time optimized)
transitRouting.AverageWaitingTimeWithExactDepartureTime: Average waiting time per trip (departure time not optimized)
transitRouting.TimeAttribute: Column for departure or arrival time
transitRouting.TimeFieldMapping: Column for departure or arrival time

gtfs.SelectedAgencies: Which agencies do you wish to import?
gtfs.SelectedAgenciesExport: Which agencies do you wish to export?
gtfs.SelectedLines: Which lines do you wish to import?
gtfs.SelectedServices: Which services do you wish to import?
gtfs.MergeSamePeriodServices: Merge services for same periods? (use with caution, the resulting service will contain all services for the same period)
gtfs.StopAggregationWalkingRadiusSeconds: Maximum walking time to aggregate stops in a node
gtfs.StopAggregationWalkingRadiusSecondsHelp: If the walking time between 2 stops is less than this value, they will be merged in the same transit node, located at the centroid of all the stops composing it. Put 0 to keep all stops in their original position. But calculation times will increase with the number of nodes.
gtfs.NewOrUpdate: Select the elements to import from the GTFS. If those elements already exists in the system, they will be updated. To keep the current agency as is, you may duplicate the agency.
gtfs.AgencyExists: Agency {{agency}} already exists. What do you want to do?
gtfs.GenerateFrequencyBasedSchedulesHelp: [Experimental] Instead of imported exact trip times, a frequency will be inferred from the schedule. The frequency for each period will be calculated to keep the same number of trips in that period. If many paths are used, the most frequent in each direction will be associated with the period. Careful, if there are multiple directions, this option will generate symetrical schedules.
gtfs.replace: Replace agency content (all current lines and schedules will be deleted)
gtfs.mergeAndIgnore: Merge new agency content (existing lines and schedules won't be re-imported)
gtfs.mergeAndReplace: Merge and update agency content (existing lines and schedules will be updated)

errors.ErrorUploadingFile: Error on the server when uploading and extracting the zip file. Please try again, if the error persist, consult the system administrator.
errors.TooManyErrorsImportingSchedules: Too many errors importing timetables, aborting.
errors.SelectedAgenciesMissing: Please select at least one agency.
errors.CannotGenerateShapeFromGtfs: Line {{lineShortName}} - {{lineName}}: shape in GTFS file {{shapeGtfsId}}: something is wrong with the stops order, or there are ambiguous loops.
errors.CannotGenerateShapeFromStopTimes: Line {{lineShortName}} - {{lineName}}: some stops do not have coordinates specified.
errors.TripHasNoShape: Line {{lineShortName}}: There is no shape for trip {{tripId}}. A path with straight lines between stops will be generated.
errors.PathGenerationErrorForLine: Line {{lineShortName}}: Error generating paths for line. The paths have not been created.
errors.PathGenerationError: An error occurred while importing paths from GTFS. Paths may not have been properly imported.
errors.ErrorImportingNodes: An error occurred while importing stops from GTFS. Stops may not have been imported properly.
errors.ErrorImportingAgencies: An error occurred while importing agencies from GTFS. Agencies may not have been imported properly.
errors.ErrorImportingLines: An error occurred while importing lines from GTFS. Lines may not have been imported properly.
errors.ErrorImportingServices: An error occurred while importing services from GTFS. Services may not have been imported properly.
errors.ErrorExportingGtfs: An error occurred while generating the GTFS file.

networkDesign.ReplayJob: New network design from this one
networkDesign.ConfigureNetworkParameters: Configure parameters for network to design

parameters.NumberOfLinesMinRequired: Minimum number of lines is required
parameters.NumberOfLinesMaxRequired: Maximum number of lines is required
parameters.VehiclesCountRequired: Number of vehicles (fleet size) is required
parameters.NumberOfLinesInvalid: Minimum number of lines must be greater than 0
parameters.NumberOfLinesMaxInvalid: Maximum number of lines must be greater than 0
parameters.VehiclesCountInvalid: Number of vehicles must be greater than 0
parameters.MaxIntervalMinutesInvalid: Maximum period must be greater than 3 minutes
parameters.MinIntervalMinutesInvalid: Minimum period must be greater than 3 minutes

help.MaxIntervalMinutesHelp: The maximum time between departures for a line. For optimal service, it is suggested to keep it lower than 15 minutes. But times up to 60 minutes are accepted.
help.MinIntervalMinutesHelp: The minimum time between departures for a line. The minimum value should be higher than 3, less than that will have no effect on the calculations.
help.LineSetAgenciesHelp: Agencies from which the lines in the network design will be selected
help.NonSimulatedServicesHelp: Existing services that will be kept in the scenario for simulation, but not modified by the network design algorithm
help.KeepLinesHelp: Lines from the network design agencies that will be kept in all scenarios. These lines are included in the number of lines in the network to design.

evolutionaryAlgorithm.LineAndNumberOfVehiclesGASimulation: Genetic algorithm with lines and number of vehicles
evolutionaryAlgorithm.KeepCandidates: Number of candidates to keep in generations
evolutionaryAlgorithm.PopulationSizeMinInvalid: Minimum population size must be greater than 0
evolutionaryAlgorithm.PopulationSizeMaxInvalid: Maximum population size must be greater than 0
evolutionaryAlgorithm.NumberOfElitesInvalid: Number of elites per generation must be greater than 0
evolutionaryAlgorithm.NumberOfRandomsInvalid: Number of random per generation must be greater or equal to 0
evolutionaryAlgorithm.CrossoverNumberOfCutsInvalid: Number of cuts in crossover must be greater than 0
evolutionaryAlgorithm.CrossoverProbabilityInvalid: Probability of crossover must be between 0 and 1
evolutionaryAlgorithm.MutationProbabilityInvalid: Probability of mutation must be between 0 and 1
evolutionaryAlgorithm.TournamentSizeInvalid: Tournament selection size must be greater than 0
evolutionaryAlgorithm.TournamentProbabilityInvalid: Tournament probability must be between 0 and 1
evolutionaryAlgorithm.NumberOfGenerationsInvalid: Number of generations must be greater than 0
evolutionaryAlgorithm.KeepGenerationsInvalid: Number of generations to keep must be greater than 0
evolutionaryAlgorithm.KeepCandidatesInvalid: Number of candidates to keep in generations must be greater than 0

help.PopulationSizeMin: Minimum number of candidates in each generation
help.PopulationSizeMax: Maximum number of candidates in each generation
help.NumberOfElites: Number of best candidates to copy directly to the next generation
help.NumberOfRandoms: Number of entirely random new candidates to add in each generation
help.CrossoverNumberOfCuts: Number of points where parent genes are cut to create offspring
help.CrossoverProbability: Probability that a pair of parents undergoes crossover to create offspring
help.MutationProbability: Probability that a gene undergoes mutation, i.e. is randomly modified. For this algorithm, a probability of 8% (0.08) is suggested.
help.TournamentSize: Number of candidates among the best of the generation that will compete for reproduction after each generation.
help.TournamentProbability: The initial probability that there will be a tournament for parent selection rather than selecting the best. This probability should not be too high, otherwise only the best will reproduce.
help.ShuffleGenes: Shuffling genes avoids proximity effects in the chromosome, where 2 lines positioned side by side will always have the same values. This helps diversify the population.
help.KeepGenerations: Number of last generations to keep for analysis after algorithm execution
help.KeepCandidates: Number of best candidates to keep for each of the generations to keep

errors.PopulationSizeMinGreaterThanMax: Minimum population size is greater than maximum
errors.CandidatesToKeepGreaterThanPopulation: Number of candidates to keep is greater than population
errors.GenerationsToKeepGreaterThanGenerations: Number of generations to keep is greater than number of generations

simulationMethods.SelectSimulationFunctions: Select functions to use for simulation

odTrips.Title: OD trips
odTrips.WalkingSpeedFactorHelp: Factor to multiply the walking speed. For example, a value of 0.8 will reduce walking speed by 20%, while a value of 1.2 will increase it by 20%.
odTrips.OdTripsSampleRatio: Percentage of OD trips to include (between 0 and 100)
odTrips.OdTripsSampleRatioInvalid: Invalid percentage of OD trips to include. Must be between 0 and 100.

fitness.odTripFitnessFunction: Cost function for OD trip result
fitness.travelTimeWithTransferPenalty: Travel time + 10 min penalty for transfers

help.odTripFitnessFunction: Select the cost function to evaluate each OD trip. The 'travel time + transfer penalty' function penalizes trips with transfers to favor direct trips.
help.fitnessFunction: Select the cost function to evaluate the scenario, from od trip fitnesses. The 'user + operating costs' function balances user experience with operational efficiency.

accessibilityMap.Title: Using accessibility maps
accessibilityMap.AccessMapMaxSampleRatio: Maximum sample ratio to test (between 0 and 1)

simulation.Name: Name
simulation.ConfirmDelete: Do you confirm deletion of this simulation?
simulation.SimulationRunDeleteScenariosAndServices: Also delete scenarios and services create during this run?
simulation.SimulationRunDeleteCascade: Yes, delete scenarios and services as well
simulation.SimulationRunDeleteNoCascade: No, delete run but keep scenarios and services created
simulation.KeepLinesSchedules: Keep existing schedules for these lines

errors.NumberOfLinesMaxNoNegative: Maximum number of lines must be positive
errors.NumberOfLinesMinHigherThanMax: Minimum number of lines is higher than maximum
errors.NumberOfVehiclesNoNegative: The number of vehicles must be positive
errors.MaxTimeBetweenPassagesNoNegative: The maximum time between passages must be positive
errors.MaxTimeBetweenPassagesTooHigh: The maximum time between passages is too high
errors.MinTimeBetweenPassagesTooLow: The minimum time between passages is too low
errors.MinTimeHigherThanMax: The minimum time between passages is greater than maximum
errors.MinTimeBetweenPassagesTooHigh: The minimum time between passages is too high
errors.SimulatedAgenciesIsEmpty: At least one agency to simulate must be selected

jobs.ConfirmDelete: Do you confirm deletion of this job? All related files will be deleted.
jobs.ConfirmCancel: Do you confirm cancellation of this job?
jobs.ConfirmPause: Do you confirm pausing of this job?

batchCalculation.ReplayJob: Create new calculation from this one

errors.InputFileUnavailable: Input file does not exist for this job
errors.ErrorGettingReplayParameters: Error getting execution data to replay calculation
errors.ParallelCalculationsIsTooLow: Number of parallel calculations should be positive or left undefined to use the maximum available

errors.DefinitionNotFound: An error occured while searching for this symbol's information on the server.
